caption: There is a reason why this restaurant shows up on every "top 10 pizza places in the DMV" list. I can't place my finger on exactly the style of crust they use, but it has a similar taste and texture to Neapolitan style. As others have mentioned, this pizza warms up well; the restaurant provides warming instructions on the box too. Can't wait to dine here in person eventually!
That pizza tastes exactly like it came from Europe! This is the pizza that ties me to DC. This pizza completes me, and it’s only $16!!!!

It's a great little neighborhood spot. I've yet to order something I haven't liked and most of their stuff I love. The short rib grilled cheese is one of the best sandwiches in the city! The baklava is divine (order more than one piece!)

A fantastic diner experience. Visited for brunch on Saturday and the place was buzzing. Restaurant itself a little chaotic, hard to know what was happening. But once we were seated, coffees and menus came quickly. Can recommend the 3 egg omelets.
Very good za! My kids loved the regular cheese pie.
This place is average at best. You could make better pizza at home. I don’t think I’d go out of my way to eat here.
best pizza in DC!!
Google page said you were open, drove 30 min, closed! Disappointed!

One of the most incredible apple pies I’ve ever had. We ordered the Sedgwick pizza which was amazing. There was a slight taste of honey and paired with the feta ranch. Incredible.  The apple pie tasted like a fancy funnel cake with thick pieces of well baked apples. An amazing meal all around 10/10.

Used to frequent all purpose and lost and found before covid. we’ve been getting takeout pizza since March and the takeout game is strong. We always end up getting the eggplant appetizer, which comes baked in a little to-go tin. It’s delicious and cheesy.

Had the Buona pizza after reading many rave reviews about it. Thought it was well-made and tasty with good crust, but nothing extraordinary. Was the chili honey supposed to be a little spicy? Felt a bit pricey for the size of the pie.  Next time, I’ll check out the Enzo the Baker pizza, but can’t see myself getting such pricey pizza from here too often. Recommend trying it out and deciding for yourself!  Edit: had the Enzo and it was delicious! Pizza still pricey though, so don’t see myself coming back regularly.  Updating stars from 4 to 5 because the pizzas are high quality even as leftovers. Tried a couple other pizza places since writing the review, and All-Purpose Shaw still stands out on top!
Amazing pizza. They do a great job with ordering online and pickup
I love it its so good
I order gluten free crust and it was not cooked. I was disappointed, I will not recommend going there.
Best pizza in DC! We have tried several pizza places and this one definitely is the best by far!

Pizza Review: Overpriced for the Small Pizza pie. I paid $21 for a Cheese Pizza. It was so salty you could sea the coarse sea salt crystals on it.  Very much so that the salt overpowered the taste. Horribly Dissatisfied  and don't reccomend at all. You've been warned

Ordered them via caviar- got the tripper pizza, the Caesar salad, garlic knots, bruschetta and fried risotto. Easily one of the best meals I’ve had in dc. The garlic knots were the stand out favorites, but everything was incredible.
This is the best pizza I’ve had in TOO long. We picked this up over the weekend. No issues with contact or anything. It was quick and easy. And the food was HOT. Seriously 10/10 would recommend
I felt it was pretty pricey for ok pizza. The sangria was nice
Great pizza, good ambience, gOod service! Not pretencious, one of the best pizzas around, a must go
Good pizza good pizza My favorite the chicken wings, the antipasto! Every time i get come to this place or take out my experience is nothing but  best.
Great service and ready Extremely good pizza.
delicious but expensive
the pizzas are delish. not sure about the $20 price tag though.
Great food and interesting menu!
Pizza is fire roasted
Yummy pizza, good to get a few and share with a table!

We were lucky enough to come during restaurant week so we got to enjoy an appetizer, pizza, and dessert for a great deal. We loved everything we had! The pizzas were delicious, I loved the pepperoni with the honey on it and my husband got a pizza that had a spicy sausage on it that he hasn’t stopped talking about! We got there early enough to snag a table without a reservation but I definitely recommend reserving a table in advance because it got very busy. The service was also the best we’ve ever had.
Great atmosphere,  food, and wine!

This restaurant is the one I like best. I eat in plenty of restaurants but here I  constantly return again and again. The stuff is very welcoming and the cuisine they serve is so good. I would always prefer to have a good meal in this place. I highly recommend this place.

I have been here twice for dinner, 1.5 years apart. The food, service, ambiance, etc was just as good my second time here as my first visit. Pizza done in a classy, romantic way. Can't go wrong with the brussels sprouts! Will be back.
Love it
Great food, had the special calzone which was tasty. The service was brilliant and was really well located to the Walter Washington convention centre.

All-Purpose Shaw is a popular spot. Walking there from Dupont, I saw people carrying boxes of pizza home.  The service was.excelllent. The server really knew the menu well and did a good job recommending wine. The ceasar salad had nice crispy lettuce and strong flavor. Portion size was good as well. The pizza had a nice taste and good crust. The overall experience was great and I'll be back next time I want pizza.
We're not in New Haven anymore.
Yummy pizza and shareable appetizers
Great pizza. The dough is beautifully made and well baked, with a variety of delicious toppings.  Wonderful cocktails, too. Highly recommended.
The Sedgwick is amazing!
Wonderful service and amazing food. Pizza add on called Dippies are smart and yummy.
Great pizza! Levi is the best bartender around!
Doughy crust, just how I like it.
Good pizza, although the toppings did not go out to edge.

Went for brunch. They don't really have much of a brunch menu, so I was disappointed not to find the usual staples of that meal, like Eggs Benedict. However, while limited, what they served was pretty decent fare. I had the Brussels Sprouts and the Pancakes, which were both acceptable.  Parking was horrendous. Not that it should be a surprise.  Not my first choice for brunch but the drinks were decently priced ($22 for bottomless) so, not a bad choice.
Always a great meal, though frequently packed
Awesome menu!!  Get the Egg Nog for dessert!!!
I admire this restaurant a lot. there is a romantic mood. The cuisine is very tasty. the service is powerful and the stuff is very professional. The pay is modest. greatly recommend.
Great pizza and Brussels.
Good pizza but not worth the price. Sodas were in 8oz glass bottles and expensive. Try Puppatella in Arlington instead—better pizza, better value.
Best pizza in DC: crust isn't too doughy or too crisp and the sauce isn't too thin or sweet.
Loved it. We recommend Sedgewick pizza, it is vegetarian.
Great pizza!
Amazing pizza. Great crust. Wonderful flavor combinations. Went out of their way to bring garlic knots fresh from the oven to accommodate an allergy at the table
OVERPRICED AND WAY OVERRATED!  I used to like this place but the one on 9th St. NW in D.C. has gone downhill.  Service is terrible and they got my order wrong TWICE!  I won't be back.
Very popular and always busy. Great food and atmosphere.
Food was great came in the second time for a carry out order the bartender was very nice! I stayed for a beer she was awesome!
(Translated by Google) Tasting reasonable prices  (Original) טעימה מחירים סבירים
This place is fantastic. Always busy so get a reservation. Carry out is easy. Highly recommend the Sedgewick and the Buona.

Definitely make a reservation for this place. However, service from the bar was fast and professional if you just walk in. Ordered appetizers and mains, with each course spaced precisely. Bartenders were attentive and professional. Every bite was delicious, with unexpected flavors. Not your typical pizza place.
Delicious, good service
Great appetizers,  awesome pizza.  Good beer selection. Nice place in the Shaw district.

I had brunch here this weekend.  I had a coffee and the Baked Egg Skillet.  The coffee was tepid warm, bitter and definitely not worth $4.  But the real winner was the Baked Egg and Capicola Bacon Skillet.  It was basically two eggs dropped in some bacony tomato sauce served in a shallow, tiny cast iron skillet.  The flavor was good on the tomato sauce, and the Capicola was tasty, if overcooked and hard.  But the portion size was insultingly small for $14.  I finished it in about 30 seconds.  If I were a restaurant owner I would be embarrassed to serve such a small  portion of food at such an exorbitant cost.   Increase the portion size to half-again as big or more, and maybe it would be acceptable.  But that was a tiny appetizer, not a brunch meal.  If I were not at brunch with a group of friends I would have sent it back.
Phenomenal!  Couldn't have had a better experience; food, drinks and service was exceptional!!!
Good pizza and desserts.
Great service, friendly staff. The pizza was one if the best I have every had. A very positive experience.
Great pies, we added the honey and Calabrian chilis, friendly service

I really liked the place, it has a good size and atmosphere .. the pizza is super different but delicious but the only thing I found that I did not like was that when we asked for soda it was a bottle too small for the price and that basically that bottle did not hurt you  not to give .. but otherwise good
Sat at the bar, was spectacular. Great food, great bartenders...
Large servings, warm environment and tasty pizza.
Amazing pizza and cocktails

(Translated by Google) Excellent pizza. Attentive assistants We arrived without reservation, crowded house but they got a place to put us. Service rating 10.  (Original) Excelente pizza. Atendentes atenciosos. Chegamos sem reserva, casa lotada mas conseguiram um local para nos colocar. Serviço nota 10.
Delicious pizza, amazing Cesar salad
Great tuna mousse on happy hour special. Wings looked great.

Had brunch here for first time. They serve you a choice of sparkling or regular water for your table. Enjoyed the Caesar salad, eggplant parm( had a garlicky sauce) and anchovy pizza ( I have an anchovy craving). Flavors were nicely balanced. Pizza came very  late due to an error, but, without us asking, the manager gave us a complimentary plate of the blueberry crepes( a very good brunch dish, very lightly sweet ricotta filling and a nice lemon flavor to go with the juicy blueberries) to enjoy while waiting. They  even removed the pizza from the bill. The anchovy pizza and crust was very light, crisp, flavorful and nice.  Food service seemed fast for most of the other guests there so we still plan to return in spite of the error.
(Translated by Google) Very tasty pizza  (Original) Muy rica pizza
Great little venue. Great antipasto and pizza.
Great pizza.

You should never serve anything on a stale bun.  Evenings are great but avoid brunch.  12 bucks for an egg, a piece of cheese, a slice of mortadella on a stale bun.  If you dont make it fresh, in house, then dont serve it.
Amazing local pizza place! Personal pizzas and small plates with fresh ingredients and interesting combinations.  Great drink list and overall good atmosphere

Really good pizza and a great vibe. If you're looking for the standard slice, you're probably going to be disappointed but All-Purpose offers a little bit more in terms of toppings and quality.  The calamari is fantastic and the drinks are also quite good. Service is attentive. The interior isn't huge by any means and it can be a little slammed sometimes. Definitely a good alternative to greasy slices!
Awesome pizza!

Unique brunch menu. Bellini could use some work. The standard was phenomenal. It pairs nicely with a side of Sicilian hot sauce. Our waitress Stephanie was quick, attentive and super polite. We went with the ricotta bruschetta (I will try to recreate at home and fail miserably) and the corn muffins with maple syrup. All of these were tasty. Perfect place to brunch before a Nats game. Will definitely return the next time we are in the area. #pizzapizza #ineedallthebruschetta

So I'm from Texas and it was my first time here in Washington and my friends and I stumbled upon this place and yall let me tell you it's the best pizza I've ever tasted. The greatest part of it all is that they have the best service ever so of course I didn't know anything about the place so I did not know how to order and they were so patient with me and helped me out. They are very fast at what they do and they have the best beverages ever. They also have very good music playing in the background which I loved and overall my experience there was the best it can be. Very inexpensive. I will surely be back next time I come to Washington.
The ambiance and waiters
Small place, very nice indeed! Pizza de italian way, I really liked it.
Had two pizzas and the artichoke - it was absolutely delicious. Three of us stopped in around 6 on a Saturday without a res and they were able to seat us immediately. Great casual pizza place
Cool atmosphere. Pizza was good.

Had high expectations for this place. All this great reviews. The pizza I got was on the sweet side as expected but nothing really special. It just didn't make it a spectacular pizza for me. The other thing was the service. Sat at the bar and I was prtactically ignored for 8 minutes. They weren't super busy at the time either. I have to give it to them the atmosphere is great. Would I come back? Probably not.. but that's just me.

This restaurant is fantastic. The staff is so friendly, the feel is homey, service exceptional and the food! The food is so fresh and delicious, expertly prepared and did I mention delicious? A gem in the Shaw neighborhood. Go with lots of friends so you can try many different menu items.
Awesome place!
I could have gotten a frozen pizza that would have been twice as good for 1/3 of the price! This place is garbage, don’t waste your time or money!!!
(Translated by Google) Very rich  (Original) Muy rico
Try all the pizzas. They are all delicious!
Solid pies and a good wine list.
Great food and atmosphere

I enjoyed the pizza here at All Purpose. We ordered the Sedgewick and man oh man was it a unique pizza. The flavor was excellent, with a sweetness from the truffle honey that you don't find elsewhere. My only criticism was that the crust was too big in comparison to the pizza. There was just too much leftover, dry dough at the end with no dipping sauce. We also ordered the crispy mozzarella and eggplant sub, which was tasty but nothing extraordinary. It was a solid sub and the chips it came with were also good. The prices were a tad bit higher than what I think it should have been. Service was good. Overall, I would come here again!
Delicious Pizza!!! You can taste the freshness in every bite!!!

The staff were all extremely friendly and the crust was fantastic. However, adding two veg ingredients to an already $19 pie put me at $23 for a pie suitable for one person. It was good, although a little sweet for my liking. But at that pricepoint I would expect much much more (taste, not necessarily size). I walked out very much regretting spending $30 (with tip) for lunch. Again, great customer service.

The pizza is really neatly made and look very appetizing I did order a regular which was pretty good but the white pizza was a little bit too sweet they should definitely explain that when you order because it's certainly not the way your regular white pie would taste.... very different and certainly to a specific taste and should have been explained by the person who was taking the order but everything else looks very good and they were very busy so get there early which probably means that the place serves good food
Delicious food, best cheese pizza ever, quite possibly.   Get your name in early or get it to go!
Best pizza in the neighborhood.  Not droopy. Has enough sauce and toppings to be very good without causing a heart attack.
Was a bit loud, not pretty to look at but great pizza 🍕
Fun atmosphere

Delicious pizza and buzzy atmosphere. We came here after a hockey game, got a table for 4 after a short wait and had a great time. The Crispy Spring Onion Arancini was a yummy shared starter and the Buona pizza with added pineapple = best pizza ever. We also shared the Nutella Bar for dessert - would recommend! We unintentionally ended up being the last group in the restaurant and did not feel any pressure to leave. Thank you for a super experience!

I came here on my first night in DC with a friend for a pizza. We ended up sharing two. We chosen a pepperoni with spicy honey and a meat with goat or buffalo cheese, I can't remember very well, both of them were amazing. The crust was thin and crispy and the taste of the pizza was from beyond the world. The place ambience is very cool with dim lights and pretty bricks around. Definitely one of the top 10s pizzas I had tried in US. If you are around, I am pretty confident you would enjoy it too.

It's a standard pizza joint - or so it seems. But in fact, it's not only one of the best pizza places in DC, but a good all-around restaurant. I haven't had anything here I didn't like. Salads, appetizers, you name it, it's all good. The only downside is that everyone knows this, so reservations are a must. It seems weird to make reservations for pizza, but it's worth it.

I walked past All-Purpose in Shaw a few times in recent weeks and finally had the chance to stop in on a Thursday evening. We arrived around 7:45 p.m. and there was about a 20-minute wait. It's a good-sized, wide-open space, so you can see the dining room, bar, and pizza kitchen all at once. We ordered the roasted garlic knots as an appetizer and the Buona pizza. It was all delicious (the garlic knots are a little pricey, but very tasty). I'm looking forward to going back and trying more items from the menu and bar.
Great food, great service, fun vibe.
Fantastic pizza
Great service, good food, reasonable price.
Very good pizzas

My very elegant friend suggested a new brunch spot, saying it was her “absolute go-to.” Obviously, I was curious. We usually brunch at Le Dip. So when she suggested a PIZZA PLACE in SHAW, I thought she’d given me the wrong address! But there we were, the first people waiting for All-Purpose to open to have a lovely pizza and salad brunch.

Nice Pizza.  Ordered a Pizza and Cesar Salad for pickup.  The Pizza was very nice.  The Salad came deconstructed to avoid the lettuce from getting soggy.  Just felt the salad was overpriced and the pizza a little spendy.  Overall the Pizza was great and recommend to anyone looking for a great Pizza restaurant.
There's nothing bad to say about this place so I won't spoil your experience with my perspective. Pro tip: you can get take out in 15 minutes or less.
Great pizza and beer
Nice eggplant parmesan! Get the Buona pizza! The location on the Capitol Riverfront is nice before ballgames!
Great pizza and really good subs.  I had the Jersey sub and it was great.  Nice balance of bread, meat, seasoning, cheese and lettuce.  Definitely check this place out

Loved it. Great food. The brussels were the best I've ever had. The cucumber and Apple salad also had a great and unique taste - light yet satisfying.  And of course, the pizza was delicious! Had to support fellow New Jersians! Great food, attentive bar tenders, and met awesome people!
The staff is very nice and its a relaxed place.

i thought the food and drinks were tasty and of high quality.  Service was excellent.  The prices were a bit higher then i am used to paying for pizza and beer but certainly in line with the area and vibe.  I did feel a bit out of place in a hoodie and jeans.
Great food, good service
It's not a place I would go again. Nothing special

Pizza was delicious. They have a high star rating because they understand what food service and customer service encompass. Resturant is stylish with beautifully crafted white marble tabletops and bar. Just visting D.C. for the holidays but will return to Shaw upon next visit. A great place to dine or just have a drink.
We visited this place last weekend. As always, staff is great and food and ambience are very good. Prices are very reasonable too and great for kids. We will visit again and again.....
(Translated by Google) Yeet  (Original) Yeet

We had the East Side pizza, and the eggplant parm. Both were delicious. The two of us finished the parm, but only got through half of the pizza.  It's a little bit on the pricey side for lunch. It's worth coming once in a while.

Shaw All Purpose Pizza catered an event we hosted at Lost and Found and every detail was seamless and easy! The pizza, salad and desserts were amazing and the staff was incredibly helpful and responsive. If you want to host an easy event with delicious food I highly recommend All Purpose for their food and catering services.
Best pizza ever... little expensive
Delicious, creative pizzas.
Great pizza and wonderful waiters!
Great pizza!
Great food and atmosphere!!
Delicious pizzas
Unique pizzas that tasted great. Service and atmosphere was excellent.
Great garlic knots. Best pizza I’ve had. Enjoyed the dinosaur kale salad and Brussels sprouts.
The best garlic knot I’ve ever had! The marinara sauce is amazing as well as the crispy Brussel sprouts!! Can’t wait to return
Amazing Pizza and they are open late.
Pizza crust was burnt, waiter was lazy and refused to bring us butter, advising they only had oil for the bread. Amazingly the tables next to us all received it. Overpriced, not worth it.
Like the decor, bar is nice; wish they had better happy hour specials for wine.

GET. THE. BUONA. Seriously, don't miss it, it's a standout. The crust on both pizzas we had was just right. Only reasons I didn't go for the fifth star were the noise, limited wine-by-the-glass selection, and the bad table they gave us on a special anniversary night.
The food is great and the pizza, it's a great place to go on a date or spend time family and friends.
Fabulous food and the best pizza and they treat the people that work for them wonderfully! That's awesome!

I have had much better experiences at this location compared to the Waterfront one.  Server was professional and accommodating. Checked in with me multiple times throughout my dinner to ensure the food was to my liking, and to pour water into my cup.  Ordered their eggplant parmigiana, and it was excellent. Seasoning was balanced, and it was served hot.  The garlic “knots” were superb as usual.  The summer corn soft serve sundae with berries was also very good.

All Purpose Pizzeria is an Italian restaurant that serves small plates, salads, and artisanal pizzas in the Shaw neighborhood of Washington, DC. The restaurant is a short walk from Mt. Vernon Square metro station on the Green Line.  For drinks, they have a nice variety of beer and wine offerings. During dinner, I enjoyed a glass of Potter's Craft Passionfruit Mosaic Dry Hopped Cider.  For dinner, we shared two appetizers, two pizzas, and three desserts. We felt that it was a perfect amount of food to feed four hungry mouths.  For appetizers, we enjoyed the Crispy Squash Blossoms and Calamari Fritto. The Crispy Squash Blossoms consisted of two squash Blossoms stuffed with fresh ricotta and garlic scapes lightly battered and friend to golden brown. They were served over a slice of Prosciutto San Daniele, roasted corn, and fennel. The Calamari Fritto consisted of crispy fried squid and lemons on a bed of creamy Calabrian Chili aioli and garnished with fresh dill.  For pizzas, between the Buona and Brassica, I savored the Buona more. The Buona Pizza consisted of tomato sauce, pepperoni, mozzarella, chili honey, basil, and grana. Adding chili honey to a pepperoni pizza was interesting (in a good way). The Brassica consisted of broccoli, parm fonduta, Italian sausage, mozz, and smoked spring garlic. It was great combination of ingredients but it had a more predictable flavor.  For dessert, among the Vanilla Soft Serve, Rainbow Cookie Cake, and Chocolate Cheesecake, I enjoyed the Vanilla Soft Serve more than the rest. The Vanilla Soft Serve consisted of a sundae dish filled with layers of vanilla soft strawberries, rhubarb, and pine nuts. It was topped with whipped cream and cherries. It was light, creamy, delicate, and smooth in texture. My second favorite would be the Chocolate Cheesecake which consisted of a double decker chocolate cheesecake in between oreo cookie crusts, topped with Nutella cream and candied hazelnuts and drizzled with fudge sauce. It was heavy, rich and chocolatey. The rainbow Cookie Cake consisted of a colorful multi layer almond cake, drizzled with chocolate sauce and topped with a scoop of whipped cream. It was much denser than I had expected.
All was fine, but pricey.
The service and ambience were good. But the pizza itself wasn't that great compared to New York Pizza.
Delicious pizza, apps, and drinks. Great neighborhood to walk around after dinner.
Good pizza, good service, clean bathrooms, cute, open atmosphere.

Really great upscale pizza restaurant! They're fairly small inside, and I think that their reservations get booked pretty far out. However, we walked in and were able to get two seats at the little bar overlooking the pizza kitchen area. They have creative, delicious pizzas and excellent service. I definitely recommend the giant chocolate chip cookie as dessert!
Rail drinks will make you vom, fam. They're okay. I had way too many. Staff dont put up with drunken  Belligerents which is a godsend. Really worth it for happy hour alone.
Best date night! We had a pizza and the anti pasta salad to split, along with the cacio e pepe appetizer. Fried garlicky pasta...It was perfect- better than I could have imagined! Highly recommend
Food is good but is a little pricey
Great place to get delicious pizza and beer. Staff is very friendly and professional.
Pizza was so yummy, but it was a bit loud and hard to hear inside

Decent pizza, and quality bar experience! Not sure why it was advertised as Jersey style pizza...still, I was impressed enough to eat it while it was still hot and burned my mouth!  If you can, resist the temptation, wait a bit, and then enjoy.
My ex work
Awesome spot. Great people. Great food and everything was good, not just the pizza. Wine list was mostly Italian and excellent. We will go back here many times. Bar space was perfect for walk ins.
Loved the white pizza with honey truffle oil. Can't wait to get it again!
Favorite pizza in the city. Only improvement I would make is to have the garlic knots available for lunch and in my home, all the time.

Very very good. Pizza was amazing and the olives were soooo good. Staff was great,  very friendly and went out of there way to awnser a question I had. We sat at the bar in front of the pizza makers and they were fun to watch. My 12 year old loved the pizza and requested we go back the next day!
Possibly the best pizza in DC proper. The crust was perfect. They also have a great selection of wines.
Delicious pizza. Expensive and small portions, but fun atmosphere.
Nice Turtle straws.
Great pizza. Delicious. Service not that great.

Ooooh, honey! This is my favorite pizzeria in DC! I love it so much I even order via Caviar if I can’t make it to the restaurant. There was a time I was here almost every other week! :-) I’m obsessed with the Buona pizza and we usually ask for it with extra pepperoni. Oh, the honey. We love the honey drizzled on the crust. Mmmm.  We’re also huge fans of the caesar salad and calamari. The salad is always fresh and crisp. The calamari is perfectly fried, especially the slivers of lemon that compliment the savory taste of the calamari and aioli. And if what I described still doesn’t get you, they have a wonderful wine list with reasonable prices. Our favorite is the valpolicella ripasso from Luigi Righetti.  Our favorite bartender, Kyle always had an interesting way to describe the tasting notes of their wines. He was funny, entertaining, and quite spot-on with the description of the wines. He is now at the AP location that recently opened in Navy Yard. We miss having him in the Shaw restaurant.
We did pick up so I’m not sure how the ambiance is, but i loved the pizza! Neopolitan style, with a wheat crust. Don’t miss the one with truffle honey!
Really great apps and pizza
Great pizza, great bartender, trendy guests.
Great pizza, great service!

It's tough to get a seat here. The quality of the food is on the higher end and very tasty. I had the garlic knots - crispy in the outside and soft on the inside. They look like cinnamon rolls. Also had the spaghetti squash - really well flavored with a citrus finish. Lastly I had the Buona Pizza - which is a tomato based, pepperoni loaded, mozzarella layered, chili honey kissed pie.  Always feel free to reach out to me on Twitter @joerazz

Probably the only sit down pizza experience that I’ve voluntarily had on more than one occasion. They’re creative, non-pretentious, and accommodating from appetizers to pizzas to cocktails. I gotta mention a dish by name here because I hope it’s always on the menu. I’m a big fan of caccio e pepe and this place does an incredible interpretation of it. The dish itself could always be heavy on the pecorino romano but...ah heck, it’s simply surprisingly well done here. The pizza? They’ve figured it out on multiple variations, you can’t go wrong with any you choose.
The food is AMAZING, employees are great, fast service. Loved visiting here with my coworkers.

It's as good as they say. We get something different every time we visit.  I have never had anything that was not complicated worth eating.  Lunch and dinner are both delicious. The second location near the baseball stadium is also very good.
Everything was perfect. Best pizza i've had
Awesome pizza! Got the one with pepperoni and honey on it.  Yes, honey.
Food is good.  Nothing on the menu is ordinary
The pizza is phenomenal!  Their beer selection is also very nice. They use tons of hipster ingredients that no one has ever heard of.
You must get the chocolate chip cookie
Best pizza in DC! Excellent service. Great vibe. We loved our waiter, Tim, he was so knowledgeable, engaging, and attentive. Definitely going to come back often!
Excellent food and service
Excellent selection of beer ..pizza was amazing!

So, I called on Sunday at 6:30 PM to see if they were busy and what the wait was for a party of 5.  The lady told me they were not busy and could sit out party without any wait.  We stayed at the Westin but were exhausted to walk after all DC walking during the day so we caught a cab and got there at 6:37 PM.  We walked in and asked to sit a party of 5 but were told that the wait was an hour.  I asked, I just called and was told there was no wait.  How can it turn from no wait to an hour wait in 5 minutes?  The African American lady who greeted us said: I am sorry, I know, there was some misunderstanding.  We just turned and walked out of the door.

Unmatched Pizza in DC Market. Try the Straticcella and Meatball. Service is 5+ We have a friend who works in the DC restaurant industry. This grants us certain luxuries. For example, we were lucky to hear about the then newly opened Rose's Luxury before it blew up and was voted best restaurant of the year for US. (A must trust for anyone in DC)  We were referred to All Purpose as a phenomenal new place. The place is in fact phenomenal. Imagine the coziness of an old Pizza Hut from your youth but updated to a cool new hipster level with much better lighting and service. That is how I would describe the place.  The waits can be long so you should get reservations in advance. Not hard to do if you give yourself a few days. If you walk in your wait will likely be an hour or hour and a half. The bar seating is generous and you can get lucky sometimes as it is first come first serve.  The service is phenomenal. We have been two times and top notch both times. They have clearly poached seasoned waitstaff from other places. They are knowledgeable about all of the food and drink. Service is attentive. It would be a 6 if you could give a 6.  The menu offers meat and cheese, hot/ cold antipasti, and also pizzas. For two, we've found that one hot and cold antipasti and a pizza will get you completely full. To me, one of the signature dishes to try is the Stracciatella. It is a young mozzarella that is wet and tender and delicious. They serve it with various fresh veggies such as corn or peas along with herbs. You eat it on top of some toast and you advance directly to heaven.  As far as hot anti pasti, I would suggest the meatballs. These are the lightest and most flavorful meatballs I have ever tasted. The rest on a bed of whipped ricotta and tomato sauce. In addition, the have a secret little pocket of mozzarella in the middle. This secret surprise, along with pops of fresh herbs, will make you happy.  We all have seen the uptick in Neapolitan. The one-minute thin pizzas cooked at 500 degrees. Some are done well, and some are just too well-done. Pizzas here are deck-oven fired and lean toward the Neapolitan style, but they are really a style all their own. You get some crisp and some chew to the dough and it is delicious. We've tried a simple pepperoni and also the Cossimo. Can't lose with either. The Cossimo is rich with the mushrooms and the truffle sauce. It should be eaten on a spring afternoon in some forest it is so earthy and good.  Go eat here. And, find this review helpful please. Enjoy!
Food is good. Service blah

Ordered a rialto calzone and the cossimo on the way home on a Friday night. Pickup was easy but finding a spot to pull aside was tricky. Pizzas were ready when I arrived so I was on my way home quickly. The calzone was delicious but somewhat forgettable, as the absolutely delicious cossimo stole the show. Mushroom lovers must order this one. For those that are not fans of truffles, don't be afraid to give it a try. I usually steer clear of anything with truffles but I am glad I gave this pizza a try. My only knock is the price for what you pay. You definitely need to order two pizzas when dining for two.

Meh. The pizza was a little burnt and the toppings were boring. Three stars for ambience and service. Maybe we'll be back for a pizza—maybe we'll just make one at home. Too much hype for a mediocre pizzeria, IMHO.

Pd. 10$ for 3 garlic rolls not very garlicky,  pd 16$ for eggplant parm. Was about 5 slices of  eggplant didn't come w/ anything.  Pd 18$ for a pizza that tasted burned and was very small .   Was highly recommended and we were very disappointed.

Frustrating visit. Walked in for lunch at around 1:15 p.m. yesterday and the place was only moderately busy. Sat at the bar where there was only two other people. I left after about 10 minutes as no one so much has acknowledged my existence or brought me a glass of water. The poor bartender was walking around doing table Service as well While others were just standing around watching. Disappointing because I really wanted to try the food.
Great pizza, good wine, and perfect dessert

Best pizza in DC. Prices are ~$16-19 per pizza (6 slices), so at first I thought it was just a bougie place with bougie descriptions but when the first slice when in my mouth, I was won over. I think my expectations were too high on the second visit - I didn’t enjoy the truffle pizza, but maybe I’m just not a fan of truffle. They have nice booths for larger parties (seats 6 ppl). Overall, delicious and great for a nice lunch out with friends.
Great pizza. Was there with friends and we shared 3 different pizzas and all were wonderful.
Don’t miss the eggplant Parmesan! It’s spectacular!
Excellent pizza and cocktails.

The pizza was well cooked and all, but the toppings on the default pies are more of the hipster type, not the traditional styles. You can get traditional still, it's just mostly ala carte. The service was pleasant, and they were busy, so we weren't the only ones with this idea, but the wait was minimal even though they were so busy. All around nice evening. Prices are on par with the rest of DC...high, but not remarkably so
The pizza is absolutely delicious. The toppings, seasonings, and cheese come together to make wonderful artisinal pizza.

Great food, great service! I highly recommend the calamari, fried artichokes, and the "Enzo" pizza. The crust on the pizza is the perfect combination of crispy and airy, with just the right amount of chewiness.
Good Pizza with thin crust and interesting toppings.
A bit pricey, but I guess the location is a PRIME location. As for the pizza, it was delicious, and innovative.
Love love their jersey style eggplant! The bar is always a great place to sit!
One of the best pizza spots in town.
Excellent pizza and great service sitting at the bar. Enjoyed the ambiance as well

(Translated by Google) If you order coke, it comes out in a pretty bottle. If you like pizza, we recommend ordering two and a half. It's really delicious~  (Original) 콜라 주문하면 이쁜병에 나옵니다. 피자도 마음에 드시는거 2가지 반반 주문하셔서 드시는거 추천. 정말 맛있습니다~

Believe the hype. All-Purpose Pizzeria served up one of the best pizzas I’ve had since moving to the area. Their dough was bubbly, with a crispy and airy crust, while the toppings were serviced on foldable, yet sturdy slice that was proofed well before being served bringing out wonderful air bubbles in the dough. I ordered the Randolph which included ingredients that wonderfully contrasted each other That brought everything to a crescendo of pizza enjoyment with every bite. I was everything I hope for in a pizza. I will definitely come back for another pie in the near future.

All-Purpose is located between Shaw and Convention Center amongst a couple other trendy restaurants. The space is small, but cozy and elegant. It’s a good choice for an intimate dinner date or happy hour, however during popular times, you may find yourself sitting too close to your neighbor’s table and their conversation. They focus on pizza, but have a good selection of antipasti, charcuterie, and bruschetta, and other appetizers. We came here primarily to try the pizza and to see how it stacked up against some of DC’s other pizza spots. We tried some appetizers and pizzas, and left quite surprised. The appetizers we had were much better than the pizzas. The AP Caesar Salad was incredible – crispy lettuce with a nice balance of parmesan, breadcrumbs, and anchovy dressing. And yet, the Roasted Garlic knots were even better – hot, slightly crispy, flavorful, and adorned with herb butter and parmesan fonduta! Which is why we were so disappointed with the pizzas. The menu featured some very creative and interesting pizzas, so we went with our waiter’s recommendations – the Buona and the West Randolph. The Buona featured a chili honey, which although sounded interesting at first, did not mix well with the mozzarella and pepperoni, and pooled in parts of the pizza. The West Randolph had entirely too much rosemary on it, and the potatoes were a undercooked and too firm. Lesson learned: sometimes it’s best to stick to the basics and perfect them before getting creative with non-traditional ingredients. We’d definitely come back – just for the salad and roasted garlic knots, though.
Dissapointing pizza, too fancy and small. Way over priced across the board and the cook time for 2 pies approached an hour. Won't go back
Good pizza, but slightly over priced in my opinion. There are better gormet pizza options in DC. That being said, if you're willing to pay, its tasty!
My pregnant wife was hungry to the point of tears. Our server was fast with the bread and got the great calzone out with minimal delay. Happy wife, happy life!
Great good, decent beer selection, sat at the bar since it was so busy not the food still came out promptly and the service was kind and fast.
Original pizzas
Pizza flavor was okay. Definitely overpriced.
pricey but good food! Great customer service!
Good eats, but pricey for burnt edges...we were too hungry to redo & it took some time to get to table. Not your usual pizzas...be prepared to try something new.
Amazing pizza. Unique pizza options.
First time eating here. Very nice. Pizza was delicious. First time tasting this style of a pizza. Very pleasant setting
Great pizza..super bar tenders...great locals place!

Really good pizza, definitely on the pricier end though. Most of the standard pizzas don't come with meat, so you're likely going to tack on +$2-4 for meat. Lines are pretty long, definitely order to go if there's a list.
Great Brussel Sprouts!!
My favorite pizza in dc
This place has amazing EATS!!! Had, a great time and will definitely be back.
This may be better than Pizza Paradiso, the pizza too beat in DC. First impression is very strong
Inventive flavors but it was just ok
"Simple" stuff done right
Solid pizza with a cozy atmosphere. Reasonable price range as well. Good for drinks, charcuterie, and an entire pizza to yourself.

Oh my gosh! The garlic pretzel knots. That’s really all you need to know. This Italian restaurant serves up magic on each and every plate. Tried the buona pizza. It was equal to the garlic pretzel knots in taste and presentation. This is one of those restaurants that is worth waiting for a seat at on a Saturday night.  Ps. Chile honey on a pizza? Yup. It’s incredibly delicious.
Very fast service! Great food! This is the best pizza I have EVER had!
Innovative pizza and cocktails at a great price.
Definitely in my top 3 pizza places. The pizza was crunchy, hot, and tasty. Beer selection is great.
Best Gluten Free pizza dough I have had.
Amazing pizza and service
Long wait so call ahead. The staff is super friendly.
Constant up selling from waiter was annoying. Decent food, but pizza wasn't the best item.
great pizza
Quite good. A bit pricey but we enjoyed the meal here. Pizza could be cheaper given it’s small and quick baked, but I’d go back.
Best pizza!

Super cozy and rustic! It's street parking so give yourselves a few extra minutes.  For starters, my bf and I shared the rice balls, brussel sprouts, and prosciutto.  BEST best best brussel sprouts I've had. We then indulged in the Bayside pizza which was "OK".  I would recommend something with a little more pizzazz...maybe a Sicilian.  Overall a very nice dinner. We will return again.
Tasted great, but the prices are high

This place was worth the hype in the most unpretentious way. I have high expectations for pizza & All Purpose holds up. Plus the Brussels sprouts and salumi are fantastic. Service was friendly and not pushy. Highly recommend
Had a spaghetti squash pasta dish that I'm still thinking about.  Craft beers are also very good.

ou MUST come here for the GARLIC KNOTS - they are AMAZING! All-Purpose is much  better than the much hyped up RPM and 1/2 the price. After a strict no carb/sugar/cheese diet, I came here for my splurge meal and it was worthy every calorie.  The garlic knots are buttery soft, they literally melt in your mouth. After eating one, I couldn't resist and gobbled the other one.  Although the pizza is not brick oven it's pretty good and quite tasty. I really like the truffle oil mushroom pizza and it makes for great leftovers. The eggplant parm is also a good size for an appetizer and quite cheesy and delicious. You can honestly order that for an entree and be set for the night.  This place gets packed over the weekend, so I recommend making a reservation. An Italian delight!
Great family dinner for 4 with a drink for about one hundred dollars. Excellent pizza, garlic knots and salumi. Need reservations.

Supposedly the chef spent months getting the exact right pizza dough.  It shows.  THe pizza is delicious, with really imaginative toppings, really fresh ingredients but the best part of the night is the appetizer menu.
Buyer Beware: the pizza at $18 is the size of a small plate!  Big ripoff and it’s not even that good!
Great food! Caesar salad and brussels sprouts were fantastic!

I dont get the hype. Pizza is decent, but it a pretty small restaurant. Loud and a little too bright inside. Just okay. Thally down the street is a better date spot if you're looking for something along those lines.
This is the hipster pizza you're looking for. A definite must revisit for me when I'm back in DC.

Great food, great cocktails, great ambiance for a pizza joint. Experienced, knowledgeable, friendly staff. My only complaint is that the pizzas are over-priced, but for downtown DC the pricing is not entirely unreasonable.
Nice place, good food!

I read great things about this place and wanted to give it a shot. We were visiting DC to celebrate my 6 year olds b-day... This place was the best! The food was SO good. My husband is vegan and they were very accommodating. The service was remarkable. Our drinks were always filled and they were just on top of everything--from the food to bussing. They were also kind people! They brought us (amazing) brussel sprouts because our pizza took longer than expected. We didn't even realize our pizza was taking that long, but we were pleasantly surprised by the generous gesture. They also brought a slice of cake for our daughter and made her a special shirley temple for her birthday. It made her day. We are just so happy with our experience and highly recommend dining here.
The Sicilian marinara pizza is fantastic. We also enjoyed the calamari and fried brussel appetizers. Would go back next time I'm in DC
Bartender was super attentive and the North End pizza was phenomenal, clams on a pizza? Why not?
Omg. Garlic knots.

Horrendous customer service. Called restaurant regarding wait time, was informed a 30 minute wait time. Upon arrival to the restaurant < 5 minutes later i was informed of a nearly 2 hour wait time due to an "influx of customers". There were no other customers waiting and more than 4 open tables available. The hostess was incredibly rude (as she has been on previous interactions). Would not recommend this place for overpriced mediocre tasting pizza.
Best pizza in DC
Great food - garlic knots are epic, Caesar was very good, pizzas were great particularly the Sedgewick. Nutella pie is so good - pretty rich but a treat. Fun vibe in the space - a little loud.
Really good pizza. Yes, agree with other reviewers that this place is pricey (especially for drinks - hence the star deduction), but overall good quality.
Pizza is great but overpriced.
The drinks, appetizers, and pizza were killer! Highly recommend!
My new fav Italian restaurant
